com.milk.objed.event
Class EditorEvent

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.util.EventObject
        |
        +--com.milk.util.BaseEvent
              |
              +--com.milk.objed.event.EditorEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class EditorEvent
extends BaseEvent

This is the class for events having to do with Editor objects.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.
See Also:

                                     EditorEvent event)

Parameters:

                                     Editor field,
                                     int index)
Construct and return a fieldAdded event.

Parameters:
source - the editor in charge
field - the sub-editor that was added
index - the index it was added at

fieldRemoved

public static EditorEvent fieldRemoved(Editor source,
                                       Editor field,
                                       int index)
Construct and return a fieldRemoved event.

Parameters:
source - the editor in charge
field - the sub-editor that was removed
index - the index it was at

getEditor

public Editor getEditor()
Get the source of this event as an Editor. It is merely a convenience to avoid having to do the cast yourself.

Returns:
the source of this event as an Editor

getValue

public java.lang.Object getValue()
Get the value of this event, that is, the value from a valueChanged event. It's the same as getArgument() but is named to match the event name.

Returns:
the value of this event

getMutability

public boolean getMutability()
Get the argument of this event as a mutability value, that is, the mutability from a mutabilityChanged event. It merely casts the argument to save you the trouble.

Returns:
the argument of this event as a boolean

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Get the argument of this event as a string description, that is, the description from a descriptionChanged event. It merely casts the argument to save you the trouble.

Returns:
the argument of this event as a String

getSubEvent

public EditorEvent getSubEvent()
Get the argument of this event as a sub-event, that is, the event from a fieldEvent event. It merely casts the argument to save you the trouble.

Returns:
the argument of this event as an EditorEvent

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Get the index of this event, that is, the index from a fieldAdded or fieldRemoved event.

Returns:
the index of this event

getField

public Editor getField()
Get the field of this event, that is, the sub-editor field from a fieldAdded or fieldRemoved event.

Returns:
the field of this event
